ROBERT deKIEFFER
Dear Harry:
Last month I received a letter from Kenneth M. McIntyre, Head
of the Bureau of Visual Education at the University of North
Carolina. He was offering to submit to the national tape reposi¬
tory a series of 26 taped radio dramas from a series entitled
American Adventure.
MARGARET W. DIVIZIA
Mr. McIntyre further stated that the matter had been cleared
with you.
ELIZABETH GOLTERMAN
Director, Division of Audio-Visual
Education, St. Louis Public Schools
HENRY R. McCARTY
Director, West Texas Cooperative
Audio-Visual Service
Texas Technological College
Since he brought up the matter of clearance with NAEB, I am
wondering if this series is one which you carry, and therefore
one which we should not include in the DAVI-AERT catalog. I
will appreciate an immediate reply as I am now working on the
supplement to the tape catalog.
j. j. McPherson In addition to this series from North Carolina, I would appre-
burea°r,Wayn°Universnsu^a 1'0n ciate knowing if any of the following are carried by NAEB:
